question_text: Which of the following statements are true about subnet masks and default gateways? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: A /30 subnet provides two usable host IPs
The default gateway must fall within the same subnet as the host
Default gateway IPs must be public addresses
Subnet masks can affect route selection
correct_answer: A /30 subnet provides two usable host IPs
The default gateway must fall within the same subnet as the host
Subnet masks can affect route selection
explanation: Only the claim about default gateways requiring public IPs is false. All others are valid: /30 yields 2 usable, subnet masks define boundaries, and they influence routing logic.
